[30;1m360 | [0m[35m* **irq**: *(Linux and BSD)*: percent time spent servicing/handling hardware/software interrupts. Ti[0m

[30;1m122 | [0m[35mupdate method. The update method call the ``set_result`` method to set[0m
[30;1m123 | [0m[35mthe AMP return string. The return string is a string with one or more[0m
[30;1m124 | [0m[35mline (\n between lines). To enable it, the configuration file section[0m

[30;1m14 | [0m[35mAMP (Application Monitoring Process)[0m
[30;1m15 | [0m[35mA Glances AMP is a Python script called (every *refresh* seconds) if:[0m
[30;1m16 | [0m[35m- the AMP is *enabled* in the Glances configuration file[0m

[30;1m23 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35mThresholds are computed by dividing the 5 and 15 minutes average load per[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35mCPU(s) number. For example, if you have 4 CPUs and the 5 minutes load is[0m

[30;1m130 | [0m[35m``NI``                    Nice level of the process[0m
[30;1m131 | [0m[35m``S``                     Process status[0m
[30;1m132 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m20 | [0m[35m  designed for informational purposes only.[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m  It's compute as following:[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35m   used memory = total - free (with free = available + buffers + cached)[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35m- **free**: memory not being used at all (zeroed) that is readily available;[0m
[30;1m24 | [0m[35m  note that this doesn’t reflect the actual memory available (use ‘available’[0m
[30;1m25 | [0m[35m  instead).[0m
[30;1m26 | [0m[35m- **active**: (UNIX): memory currently in use or very recently used, and so it[0m

[30;1m3 | [0m[35mContainers[0m
[30;1m4 | [0m[35m==========[0m
[30;1m5 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35mIf you use ``containers``, Glances can help you to monitor your Docker or Podman containers.[0m
[30;1m7 | [0m[35mGlances uses the containers API through the `docker-py`_ and `podman-py`_ libraries.[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35mYou can install this dependency using:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1370[0m[34m of [0m[33m2315[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000704[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Hostname[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/glances-4.3.1/docs/gw/kafka.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m.hostname[0m
[30;1m17 | [0m[35m    # Tags will be added for all events[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35m    #tags=foo:bar,spam:eggs[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35m    # You can also use dynamic values[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35m    #tags=hostname:`hostname -f`[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35mNote: you can enable the compression but it consume CPU on your host.[0m
[30;1m23 | [0m[35m[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m1371[0m[34m of [0m[33m2315[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000704[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.DataExfiltration.Hostname[0m
  Severity: [36mImportant[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/glances-4.3.1/docs/gw/kafka.rst[0m
   Pattern: [32m.hostname[0m
[30;1m17 | [0m[35m    # Tags will be added for all events[0m
[30;1m18 | [0m[35m    #tags=foo:bar,spam:eggs[0m
[30;1m19 | [0m[35m    # You can also use dynamic values[0m
[30;1m20 | [0m[35m    #tags=hostname:`hostname -f`[0m
[30;1m21 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m22 | [0m[35mNote: you can enable the compression but it consume CPU on your host.[0m

[30;1m10 | [0m[35mOn your Linux system, you will need to have:[0m
[30;1m11 | [0m[35m- hddtemp package installed[0m

[30;1m4 | [0m[35m======[0m
[30;1m5 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m6 | [0m[35mYou can generate dynamic graphs (SVG format) in a target folder. The generation[0m
[30;1m7 | [0m[35mstarts every time the 'g' key is pressed in the CLI interface (if Glances has been[0m
[30;1m8 | [0m[35mstarted with the --export graph option).[0m
[30;1m9 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m10 | [0m[35mThe graph export module can be configured through the Glances configuration file:[0m

[30;1m1994 | [0m[35m===========[0m
[30;1m1995 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m1996 | [0m[35m    Glances v2.0 is not a simple upgrade of the version 1.x but a complete code refactoring.[0m
[30;1m1997 | [0m[35m    Based on a plugins system, it aims at providing an easy way to add new features.[0m
[30;1m1998 | [0m[35m    - Core defines the basics and commons functions.[0m
[30;1m1999 | [0m[35m    - all stats are grabbed through plugins (see the glances/plugins source folder).[0m
[30;1m2000 | [0m[35m    - also outputs methods (Curse, Web mode, CSV) are managed as plugins.[0m
